I've found the following heuristics useful; if the life
of the =
child is inextricably linked to the life of the
parent, then kill the child=
 when the parent is killed.
Otherwise, don't.

In order to kill off indepen=
dant children, I'd be tempted
to use DAV's "Depth" feature on a delete to d=
elete the
childen.  But I've never implemented that.

MB
